medical_history.chief_complaint: Inadvertent esophageal intubation and subsequent gastrointestinal bleeding.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient suffered from inadvertent esophageal intubation during surgery, leading to gastric overdistention and subsequent linear mucosal tears observed during endoscopy after the event.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of cardiac arrest due to unrecognized hypokalemia and hypomagnesemia during a previous thyroid surgery; diagnosed Gitelman syndrome; diabetes; gastroesophageal reflux disease; thyroid disease; history of hysterectomy, appendectomy, thyroidectomy, breast biopsy, and exploratory laparotomy for ovarian cancer.
